meanings.sent1: She wore a twanky dress to the party.
meanings.sent2: The new shoes she bought were very twanky.
meanings.sent3: His twanky hat matched perfectly with his outfit.
meanings.sent4: The twanky sunglasses made her look like a celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The twanky scarf added a touch of elegance to her look.

meanings.sent1: He paid for the concert ticket with a twanky.
meanings.sent2: She found a twanky in her pocket while doing laundry.
meanings.sent3: The twanky in his wallet was the last of his cash.
meanings.sent4: She saved every twanky she earned in a jar.
meanings.sent5: The twanky was crumpled but still usable.

meanings.definition: Twanky (verb): to dance or move in a lively and energetic way
meanings.sent1: The kids twankied around the living room, laughing and having fun.
meanings.sent2: At the party, everyone twankied to the upbeat music.
meanings.sent3: She twankied her way through the crowded dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The leaves twankied in the wind on a breezy day.
meanings.sent5: The flames twankied in the fireplace, casting a warm glow.
